subject: Data
title: Obama's Open Government Directive
description: A short lesson to help you apply Obama's Open Government Directive.

hook.text: On his first day in office in 2009, Barack Obama signed a memo ordering federal agencies to open their data.

buildup.text: The Open Government Directive required agencies to publish data in machine-readable formats on data.gov.

discovery.text: Data.gov launched with 47 datasets. Today it hosts over 300,000 datasets from federal agencies.

twist.text: Critics noted that many datasets were trivial â€” weather data was already public. Sensitive data stayed hidden.

climax.text: Despite limitations, the directive established open data as a presidential priority and inspired global imitators.

punchline.text: One memo turned open data from concept to policy.

quiz.question: How many datasets does data.gov currently host?
